title: Fluid flow compare flow rates in pipe

content.question: Which of the following correctly compares the mass flow rate <math alttext="Q sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>A</mi></msub></math> of the water at Point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> to the mass flow rate <math alttext="Q sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>B</mi></msub></math> of the water at Point <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> and provides a valid justification?

choices.label: <math alttext="Q sub B equals Q sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>B</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>A</mi></msub></math>, because the speed of the water at point <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> is the same as the speed at Point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math>.

<math alttext="Q sub B equals Q sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>B</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>A</mi></msub></math>, because the flow rate must remain constant throughout the pipe.

<math alttext="Q sub B is less than Q sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>B</mi></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>A</mi></msub></math>, because the greater cross-sectional area at Point <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> means the speed of the water at Point <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> is less than the speed of the water at Point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math>.

<math alttext="Q sub B is less than Q sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>B</mi></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>A</mi></msub></math>, because the water slows down as it moves vertically upward between Point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> and Point <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="Q sub B equals Q sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>B</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>A</mi></msub></math>, because the flow rate must remain constant throughout the pipe.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
